Legal_Issue: Jurisdiction to grant a stay of deportation
Governing_Law: s. 18.2 of the Federal Court Act
Application_Facts: Applicant fears harm upon return to El Salvador; challenges 'no credible basis' decision which underpins deportation order
Court_Ruling: Court has jurisdiction to grant a stay as the deportation order's validity is indirectly challenged
Claimant_Status: Applicant who sought refugee status in Canada
Defendant_Behavior: Issued deportation order based on rejection of refugee claim
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of harm upon return to El Salvador; lack of credible basis decision being challenged
Legal_Standard: Interim relief under s. 18.2 of the Federal Court Act
Assessment_Factor: Connection between challenged decision and validity of deportation order
Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed; focus on legal jurisdiction
Evidence_Used: Applicant's fear of harm in El Salvador
Application_Basis: Challenging foundational decision that led to deportation order
Evidence_Assessed: Fear of persecution or harm in country of origin
Relief_Sought: Stay of deportation pending appeal resolution
Governing_Rule: Court may issue interim orders if appropriate under s. 18.2
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm upon return to El Salvador
Cause_Description: Applicant denied refugee status, appealed decision, and requested stay of deportation
Evidence_Handling: Considered in context of jurisdiction for interim relief
Residency_Compliance: Applicant was in Canada seeking refugee protection
Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether court has jurisdiction to stay deportation when underlying decision is challenged indirectly
Evidence_Assessment: Focus on legal consequences of challenging basis for deportation
Decision_Rationale: Challenging the 'no credible basis' decision indirectly undermines the deportation order, thus engaging court's jurisdiction
Legal_Standard_Applied: Authority to grant interim relief under s. 18.2 of the Federal Court Act
